frontmatter.title: Building Microservices on OpenShift for Cloud Natives Hands-on Workshop
frontmatter.lead_text: The OpenShift Commons Gathering will be live virtually on July 29th, co-hosted with IBM Cloud. This Gathering features a hands-on interactive workshop as well as live panels and AMA sessions to get your Cloud Native journey started.
frontmatter.info_text: This event has been postponed due to technical/logistics issue. Check back soon for a new date/time and join us for a hands-on interactive workshop on deploying Microservices for Cloud Natives on OpenShift 4.3 on IBM Cloud. You will learn how to deploy and scale a microservice, use an operator to deploy IBM Cloud and bind to a microservice, Observe the cluster using Log Analysis with LogDNA and using IBM Cloud Monitoring with Sysdig. You'll get step-by-step guidance from leading Cloud Native experts from IBM Cloud and access to hands-on virtual labs on IBM Cloud.
frontmatter.event_footer_text: Please note: The hands-on workshop will cover deploying microservices to an OpenShift cluster, viewing logs and metrics, and the use of an operator to provision IBM Cloud services. You'll get step-by-step guidance on Initializing an OpenShift application with a repository URL resulting in a Builder, Deployment, and Service. Services covered:  OpenShift, IBM Cloudant,  LogDNA and  IBM Cloud Monitoring with Sysdig.
